inn1.comm: a bit of swing at 125kph, straightening down the line and it's defended first up on the front foot
much of the same, another tight delivery on a good length and straight, Hayden looks to muscle an on-drive along the floor towards mid-on but takes the power out of the shot
arced away from the left hander, who looks to use the width with a cover drive
a curve away on off, just a touch full and Hayden pushes it hard through straight mid-on and it rolls away
the offcutter perhaps slipping down the leg-side after pitching on off, Hayden was tucked up there and trapped
more curve, and a touch short, driven on the back foot to the covers and they shuffle through a single
some good carry through first up, sliding down off across the left hander who elects to leave the decent length delivery
down off again, tighter now, though and it straightens through to Sangakkara
chopped an inside edge down after Malinga found some extra bounce outside off and he was lucky to survive as the ball crashed past leg stick. A big lack of footwork noted also
the ball came on well again and Hayden makes sure to defend back do the bowler this timem, squeezing it out on the back foot
a quick dab-and-run into the covers, testing out the fielders there
good delivery, pitched just outside off, rose sharply while nipping back into the left hander who adjusts to defend down on the back foot
oh, plenty of seam movement away from the left hander as it pitched wide of off and had him chasing the ball with a cut
swing in on middle and it's turned well off the thigh to midwicket
another straightish delivery, defended down on the front foot
and the bowler got away with one, as Hayden strode outside off, but not far enough over to the swinging delivery and sent what would have been a comfortable catch to first slip
on middle, and aiming towards leg, Hayden gets over the ball and drives strongly in front of midwicket
straightish delivery, on off, a touch short and defended off the back foot
that one nipped back just a touch and is defended
shoots through the channel, licks through well outside off and so the batsman is quick to shoulder arms
now then, nipped back in from just outside off and was ever so close as Hayden shouldered arms
an easy leave this time, the ball pushed wider down the channel
squeezed off the legs to midwicket and some comfortable running results
outside off, enough room to be driven back through mid-on
outside off, short one, defended back down
defended on the front foot this time and they squeeze out a run
a touch of width on a good length, driven into the covers and the call of "Wait, there" is a good one as it's tidied up quickly
an easy single, hit again to the covers, and they ease through
rolled up there on off, a single to mid-on, and it's too easy for Sri Lanka's liking - they just jogged that through, Jayasuriya's throw missing the sticks
nipped back in from outside off, defended into the covers
outside off, looked to cut that but ended up cut-driving into the covers for an easy single
waited for one on off, turned off the legs in front of square
outside off, wide, a deliberate aerial flash through gully that at first looks accidental, but was well placed
wide again, outside off, smashed through extra cover, Amerasinghe gets a hand on it at wide mid-off
very straight, very true, rises a touch and asks to be defended back down on the back foot. The request is met
straight, short and the batsman thinks first about sweeping, then adjusts to defend back down
an easy single into the covers

the most entertaining shot so far doesn't even get a four as it plugs in the deep, Hayden smashes it off the toes up and over through cow corner. They should have got three, but he initially took only two steps out of his crease, thinking that had gone all the way
a driven through mid-off this time
good response, tight on middle, and defended on the front foot
tucks him on to the back foot in front of middle and leg, worked just on the on-side
outside off, squeezed to point
right up there and defended on the front foot
turned off the legs through square
outside off, crashes to point, good running from Hayden to make it through
outside off, turned into short midwicket, and they don't run through
hello, massive. Super shot, the ball taken off the toes and lifted high and in front of midwicket and it goes five rows back
defended on the back foot
right up there on off, pushed into the covers
pushed across the right hander, left alone
outside off, played on the front foot
again pushed across the right hander, Amerasinghe has started his third ODI well, having also bowled well against India earlier this week
a full toss and a simple cover drive driven into the ground and then bounces up
outside off, driven into the covers
on leg, turned into short midwicket, straight to the fielder and there's no run
swung past the right hander, defended towards mid-off
on middle and leg, driven out to mid-on
on leg, pushed right up there, and turned to square leg
short ball, on off, and cut late off the back foot through gully
pushed right up there on off, defended off the back foot into the covers
great ball down off, Gilchrist tempted into fishing outside off at one which goes slightly away from him
got hold of it this time, outside off, driven hard to the covers where it's picked up well
pushed across him at 141.5kph, driven to the covers
good length, tight outside off, turned off the legs towards square, didn't get hold of it
a powerful blow, down the pitch, hits the ball on the up over the bowler's head and found so much muscle to do so
stars outside his crease again, and yorks himself coming down to look to drive
down the track and plays on the front foot
on leg, looks to turn it round, but the ball's too quick on him
outside off, guided to the covers
slung in straight, defended on the back foot dead in front
a touch of room outside off, cut to point where Dilshan tidies up and delivers back in
pushed up there on off, driven back straight but without the power
outside off, overpitched, and you can't bowl there to him, Gilchrist launches a full-blooded cover drive that shoots along the floor
on leg, driven out to mid-on
outside off again, the length is wrong once more and Gilchrist goes for another crashing shot, wider over extra cover this time. It plugs deep but has enough legs to run on
on leg, too short, and Gilchrist pulls it up through midwicket and it's picked up inside the boundary
Amerasinghe breaks through as Hayden, batting out of his crease, once more, comes down the track and is cramped up straight, mishitting on the up out to short midwicket
right up there in the blockhole on off and defended back forward
bowled well, up there, defended on the front foot
stands and defends on the back foot
nipped back in from outside off on to middle, chopped into short midwicket
banana-ed away from the right hander on a good length, and Ponting was content to leave
pitches on middle, the ball nips out from off, and pushed into the covers
Ponting waits as the ball comes in at 129.2kph, moves out, and worked off the back foot to point
outside off, pushed to the covers
short ball and Gilchrist nearly departed in a Hayden-stylee way, turning and pulling just wide of long-on
he's living dangerously, turned off the hips with a pull, tucked up a bit and the ball miscues up but safe
outside off, pushed into the ground straight back towards the bowler
outside off, driven back out to straight mid-off
right up there, full and straight, defended forward. A shout for lb, but iur was going down leg
outside off, worked into short midwicket
outside off, tried to work it forward
ooh, very well bowled, cutting away off the seam as it ptiched outside off, the edge was just wide of the diving first slip where Jayawardene made an excellent effort. He couldn't have done more
worked forward to mid-on
pushed across him on off, defended on the front foot
slowish delivery at 131.2kph, on off, defended on the front foot
round the wicket, up there on off, worked to short midwicket
full delivery on off, overpitched, driven on the up through mid-on
right up there outside off, driven out to mid-on
outside off, defended back down on the back foot
outside off, worked to mid-on, winged back in the non-striker's
up there, straight, played back forward
on leg, turned to midwicket, they look for two but stick with one
the ball surprises him and keeps low, defended back well down on the back foot
pushed forward to mid-off for a quick single
turned well off the legs through backward square
nipped back in from outside off in front of off, played to short midwicket
short outside off, played down through gully off the back foot
Murali's roared in, on off, worked out to short midwicket
good loop, floated in on middle, the batsman gets right over it to defence
on leg, turned into short midwicket
outside off, turns in to middle and defended on the front foot
pushed up there and defended
Gilchrist leaps on the touch of room, rocking on to the backfoot and cutting out
pushed across off and defended on the backfoot
outside off, Ponting waits for the bounce which doesn't come and drives off the back foot and the bottom of his bat
played well on the front foot
right up there, squeezed out to point on the crouch
Jayawardene picks up a sharp chance at first slip, Ponting opening the face and running down to his opposing captain who snaps it up low, good catch
across the right hander, tight and a good length, worked into the covers
up there on the front foot, played forward
steals a quick single into the covers
good loop and length on off, defended forward tightly
on off, turned into short square
right up there on off, driven out to the on-side
waits on off for one which pitches on a good length and is driven to the covers
turns on to leg and moved out to the leg-side
drags it down a touch, Gilchrist waits for one which doesn't carry on, pulled round with control to midwicket
turned back from off towards middle, Clarke looks to work the ball through midwicket
slowish ball at 113.8kph, good angle and length, dipping outside off and defended on the front foot. No room to manoeuvre there at all
turned off the legs through the 45
round the wicket, moves in to the left hander from outside off, defended back into the covers
defended back into the ground on off
loop in from outside off, turned on to middle, worked out to midwicket
defended on the front foot
on off, a touch short, swept hard through square leg
down the track, overpitched, and lifted high over long-on
on off, turned away from the right hander, cut out to point
on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
right up there, driven to mid-on
nipped back in from a tight line outside off, worked into the covers
pushed in on leg, and worked out well off the toes to midwicket
wide outside off, waited and cut down on it through gully
low full toss on leg, played down over the ball to work it through midwicket
on leg, jabbed out through midwicket
waited on the back foot, the ball kept low and was defended down on the back foot
driven back out to long-on
turned off the legs to midwicket, Kapugedera tidies up well
good turn, Clarke rocks back to try to open up the off-side but it came back sharply
driven out through mid-off and there's some good running
on leg, pulled round off the back foot behind square
nipped back in from outside off, driven forward
outside off, plenty of width, cut out
on off, overpitched a touch, driven out from off to mid-on
outside off, beaten by the slower ball, the batsman through the ball before it came on
swivelled round this time
driven out to mid-on off the toes
outside off, Gilchrist played for the turn which didn't come, and so he was forced to reach out further to cut down into the ground
outside off, Gilchrist cautious again, coming out and pushing into the covers
right on middle, Gilchrist drives out to mid-on for a well-thought-out fifty and he celebrates with a raised bat
nipped back in from outside off, looks to turnb it down through midwicket
gets hold of the knock to midwicket this time
on off, worked out to midwicket
turned back in from outside off, pushed back out on the front foot
outside off, turned away, cut out to point
nips back in but enough length to work to midwicket
the ball almost plugged on the track then on middle, forcing Gilchrist to improvise a flick up and round through the 45
defended this time
outside off, cut off the backfoot to point
outside off, cut through gully now
outside off, swept behind square
outside off, nipped back defended back
more defence
comes down the track and driven to mid-on
low full toss on leg, pushed off the legs to midwicket
tucked off the legs and it flew off the top of his bat deep to Murali
right up there on off, well flighted, driven out to mid-on
outside off, cut back down and that was well played
angled too far down leg, turned off the legs square
turned in and pushed back out
rips past the outside edge this time
waited and worked into the covers, Gilchrist setting off immediately for a sharp single
turned back in from outside off on to middle, worked out without much power to leg gully where it's fired back over to Murali who's ready to take the bails but the batsman was back in
on off, pushed forward in a defensive manner
outside off and Clarke goes on the attack, down on one knee and slog sweeping out to Malinga whose hat flies off as he runs round to return
outside off, good length, defended on the back foot
right up there on off, played forward defensively
slower ball, well bowled, causing questions in the mind of Gilchrist who decides to play out away from his body, almost at the last minute
the ball nips back in from outside off, Gilchrist waits and is patient again in defence
a long and loud appeal for one which dips low and Gilchrist plays across the line. It hit him in front of middle, having come in from off, and would have gone on to hit the stumps
driven out wide of mid-on to get off the mark immediately
worked out to the cover region
right up there on off, defended forward
outside off, turns back in, pushed back out
outside off, played out to point
driven out to mid-on
nipped back in from outside off, defended quietly in front
extra loop, so much so it's a full toss, got away with it as the batsman drove out to mid-on
right up there outside off, defended again
on leg, turned off the legs through midwicket
outside off, run down to third man. A good throw from Murali could have possibly had Symonds there. It was referred but there was only ever one outcome there
on leg, turned off the toes behind square, good running to come back for two but Sangakkara appeals in vain for the run-out. It's not even referred this time
outside off, cut down late down to third man
nipped back in from outside off, straightens and Symonds waits to defend back down
good return ball again, Clarke reaching out outside his off stump to drive away from his body, and that bounced over his bat
outside off, again Clarke leans out, defends this time
outside off across the right hander who leaves it through
outside off, driven hard through the covers and Tharanga is the man who tidies up
pushed across the right hander who waits and defends into the covers off the back foot
outside off, good length, lets it go through
outside off, full delivery, worked to mid-on
pushed right up there, driven back out to mid-off
dragged down a touch slower, driven back out to mid-off
pushed down the leg side, turned round in front of square
on middle, back away and cut hard back out to the covers
on off, defended on the back foot
outside off, pushed into the covers
up there on off, played back down this time
outside off, wide, Symonds goes for the drive outside off, and Sangakkara does well to stop it, standing up
gone this time, Symonds flashes hard to extra cover where Kapugedera takes a great catch at head height, and it was travelling
outside off, pushed forward first up
pushed forward, Hussey's keen to run through and get off the mark, but Clarke wisely sends him back
driven out to mid-on
great ball on off and a great length, there's no run there, Clarke defends  accordingly
down leg and that's the first extra of the innings! It's been a great bowling and fielding display in that regard
back on the money, defended on the front foot on off
nipped back in from outside off, that one kept very low and Clarke did well to watch the ball on to the bat, adjusting at the last second to play it down
outside off, again had to stab a bit low at it
outside off, slightly short, played off the back foot into the covers
overpitched slightly just outside off, and well pushed out straight towards mid-on, and some good running brings up the two
on leg, driven out to straight mid-on once more
nipped back in from just outside off, kept very low indeed and Hussey defended onthe back foot in front of his shins
outside off, Hussey waits and opens the face, running it gently down to third man
slower delivery, it just hangs in the air as it flights down on leg, the ball brushed off the pads behind square
nipped back in from outside off, pushed to short midwicket
outside off, cut hard through third man off the toe of the bat, not the place he was aiming for (that was the covers) and he moved back behind the stumps to do so
recovers well to place it right on off, the batsman defending behind it
outside off, Clarke squares up and runs an inside edge down through third man
pushed across the left hander from over the wicket, Hussey pushes forward and they run a quick single
on off, Clarke backs away, exposing his stumps and the ball's driven hard through the covers, just past the fielder there to bring up a well-timed fifty
outside off, pushed into the covers
on middle, defended on the front foot, but pushed far enough to pick up the single
overpitched on off and with enough width to carry past cover and beat the fielders. Scorching timing and even better placement
bent back in to the left hander, who drives out to the covers
backs away once more, and drives out to cover where Jayawardene tidies up
turned in on the legs, pushed back out off the shins just in front of square
down leg, Clarke comes forwad and pushes out to midwicket where a misfield from Murali allows the second
on middle, that one at 137.3kph, defended tidily forward in front
pushed across the left hander from over the wicket, took some pace and dropped it down to 130 from his usual 138-mark, and beat Hussey who was lucky not to get a top edge on that
waited and pushed down to third man where somehow they manage to get back for two. Some quick sprinting there
short ball, wide outside off and Hussey comes out of his crease, and cuts back into the hands of Dilshan at backward point. It was straight to him, but stroked hard so a good catch
Hopes squares up to that one for his first ball and plays it down towards third man
nipped back in outside off, short, and played back down off the back foot
outside off, flayed hard out in front of midwicket
outside off and played round in front of square leg this time, where Jayasuriya - still with the chin plaster on - tidies up
played forward this time
a long way across his stumps, doosra pitches on leg and would have gone wide so the appeal is turned down
outside off, the doosra again spinning away, turned to short midwicket
down on one knee, looks to cut to the covers
swept round through the 45, and they sensibly decide not to go for the second
short outside off and a great shot from Hopes, waiting outside off and pulling it from face height round in front of midwicket
backs well away bhind the stumps to cut into the covers - the ball following him - and bring up the 200
outside off, stands on the toes, and cuts to the covers
outside off, driven out hard through the covers
driven hard to mid-on and they run well
outside off, worked into the covers
worked forward this time
comes right out of the crease and on the off-side, defended on the front foot
outside off, swept on the front foot out to deep midwicket
flighted up there on off, driven out straight to long-off
plays it out square to finish his spell
outside off, driven out
slower ball, Hopes saw it coming and delayed the shot, lofting the bowler with a cut-pull and didn't get hold of it, the ball dropping just wide of mid-off
comes down and works out to the covers
on middle, driven out to mid-off
dragged short and lofted over mid-on
the slider, slid full and wide down leg
outside off, the batsman comes out, drives to the covers
on off, a touch short, and Hopes doesn't quite get the timing but there's enough muscle to work that in front of midwicket
down the track and turned off the legs behind square
down the track to meet a full toss, driven wide of long-on, doesn't connect again but there's enough power on it for them to run up a single
worked round to fine leg
down the track, backed away from the ball but had to stretch out again and gets the top edge which flies through third man
up there on leg, dug out to midwicket
way down leg and Hopes got some bat on it with a late bat, Sangakkara did well to stop the ball and it was given as leg-byes, to Sanga's disgust
yorker, up there, dug back out to the covers
on off, Hopes timed it really well to Murali at wide mid-on, who runs round well, lunges forward and the ball bobbles up and hits him straight in the front teeth
hip-high full toss controlled into midwicket and they cheekily scamper two
outside off, the ball pushed right up there, tucks it off his toes into midwicket

on middle and leg, the batsman backs away leaving his stumps exposed - this has been favoured by Australia - and has to reach back out to cut through the covers, his hand coming off the bat as he did so
easy drive out
down the track outside off, took his eyes off that one, his head facing towards the leg-side as the ball splays up towards mid-off
driven out forward again
down the track outside off, but backed away again to work out behind point, Jayasuriya fielding inside the rope
Clarke down the track and walks over a push off the legs to midwicket
way down leg, rapping Hopes on the back leg and they shuffle out a single, Amerasinghe's lone appeal goes in vain
backs away and is way behind the stumps when he works it back out through midwicket
Clarke wanders across his stumps and works it out to midwicket
Clarke shuffles back and then shuffles across, taking the ball on off and working out to the covers
outside off, swing away, and the batsman comes out of his crease, but it's scooped to backward point where Dilshan does the honours
on leg, Lee looks to scramble the single as the ball goes back to Sangakkara who rolls it back to the stumps and misses
another dot ball, Lee playing forward, Malinga taking it and mock-shies at the non-striker's stumps

inn2.comm: thats a cracker to start off with! Short of a length, extra bounce, lovely seam position, good carry through to the 'keeper does it for Tharanga, pushing forward and missing
first runs, as Tharanga pushes a fuller, inswinging delivery back in the air to Lee's left but he cannot get his outstretched hand there in time ... that ball swung back in off a length
nasty delivery, bouncing sharply off a length as Jayasuriya pushes forward outside off stump, it rears up off the seam at a sharp pace and he does well to keep it down in front of gully
short one on leg stump, forcing him up and defending to square leg
good ball, fuller just outside off stump and coming in, Tharanga drives and gets an inside-edge to the man at square leg
wider one, back of a length and going away and the umpire does his thing

falls safe! Tharanga plays loosely at a short one and the ball balloons up in the air and drops safely to the right of Clarke, running across from point, they steal a single and the fielder hits the stumps but the umpire feels the batsman was safe
back of a length outside off stump, Tharanga shoulders arms
fuller one, as he looks for movement, it pitches wide and goes away
this one's on off stump, he gets in line and drives loosely to midwicket
shorter one, enough width for Tharanga to stand and open the face, running it wide of Clarke at gully this time for a single
beaten, or did he pull the bat back? Bracken hits a good length, the ball straightens and sits up and Jayasuriya, pushing forward, manages to get out the line
slower ball, fuller and swinging, Jayasuriya pushes off the front foot, tentatively, into the covers and they scamper a single
back of a length outside off, upright seam, he gets across and defends
chases a fuller one just outside off stump, with too much bottom hand, and drags it back to Lee's left
good change-up ball, slower and fuller, drawing him into the defensive
quick and shorter, rising and he gets Jayasuriya up on the toes, keeping it down nicely in front of point
back of a length, worked across Jayasuriya, who leaves this one be
back of a length outside off stump, he defends with an angled bat and the ball rolls towards square leg
short of a length, comes back into him and he defends to Clarke at point
gets some width and he cuts into the ground, one bounce and just wide of point, Lee does the fielding and keeps them to two
back of a length and wide so he opts to let it go through
fuller in length, he gets to the pitch and drives straight to Symonds at cover
but this time he finds the gap, driving through the covers and the quick outfield takes care of the rest, that was a good shot on the up, against the swing
back of a length, he gets across and runs it along the ground to gully
short and wide, he plays it in the air through the gap at gully for one
full just outside leg stump, swings down and raps him, no appeal as that was clearly doing too much
back of a length, seams back in but he gets right in line and pushes with a straight bat, calls for the sharp single immediately as Johnson is slow at mid-off
full on the stumps, he shuffles across the line and clips to midwicket
short, wide and he slashes uppishly over gully, one bounce and it beats a sliding third man, that was thrashed very hard
and thats the end of that! Lee gets his man, pushing tamely at one on a much better length and the inside-edge nips back and rattles off stump

edged and taken! Bracken strikes, pitching on a full length outside off stump and sucking Tharanga into a very loose drive from the crease, the late swing does the trick and Gilchrist takes the easiest of catches
full on middle and off, swing on view and Jayawardene clips that uppishly through the gap at midwicket to get off the mark first ball
short one first up, Sangakkara pulls from outside off stump very hard and just over  a leaping square leg fielder
fuller one but down the legs and he taps that into the gap at mid-on
pitches outside leg, lifts into him, tucked towards short fine leg
short of a length, little too wide, thats a touch shot just wide of point
too wide but Sangakkara mistimes his cut shot into the ground at point
nasty bouncer, 141ks over middle and leg, gets Sangakkara ducking and there's a smile shared between batsman and bowler afterwards
very full and wide outside off and he lets this one go through
short of a length, he gets tall and guides it to Clarke at backward point
ah thats a shot! Sangakkara gets to the pitch of a good-length delivery and creams that on the up through the covers to cue hysteria from the faithfuls in the crowd
short and wide, cut hard but straight to backward point
causes some immediate trouble, straight and popping up to the outside edge as the batsman squares up behind it
on to the legs and tightens up the batsman who doesn't have the room he would like instead squeezing it in just into the leg-side
curved back round on leg, tucked down off the hips, more defensively than anything
stays over the wicket, pushes across the right hander at a questioning angle, answered with a leave on the back foot
nips back in from outside off, played back down with a straight bat
beats the outside edge with one which zooms at just under 147kph, Jayawardene lucky not to get any bat on it as he lashes a would-be off-drive at the ball
stays over the wicket, pushes across the left hander
outside off, Sangakkara moves outside and into the line of the ball, goes for the bosh over midwicket, takes a huge outside edge which goes over third man and nearly over the rope
a tad fuller this time, goes across him but well wide enough to leave
short on off and pulled from there just in front of square
outside off and pulled hard from the bottom of the bat through midwicket
ooh, dropped, but that was a hard chance, Sangakkara lashing a full-blooded cover drive just past Symonds whose leap resulted in him getting a fingertip there
Jayawardene again struggles with a Johnson delivery, flashing forward and the ball flying past the edge
a non-contentious wide, barely within the marks outside off
outside off, room enough to drive through cover where Symonds stops the ball and Clarke returns from just inside the rope
left-armer to left hander, Sanga waits on line with off and places the ball to the left-side
worked off the legs to short midwicket
a huge boom away from his body at a possible wide that's not given
back on it now, tighter, defended off the back foot
up there on off, driven out to the cover
only a hint of width outside off and Sangakkara creams that off the back foot with a powerful cut through point
tightens him up with a full ball on the toes, defended on the front foot
driven out to mid-on for a quick single
a quick dab-and-run through
defended on the back foot
on off, played forward
a hint of swing back in to the right hander on leg, who waits and defends quietly
down the wicket, rocks back and edges through a would-be booming drive to a short one outside off, the ball cutting away off the seam
pushed across him and he leaves it first up
on off this time, perhaps a touch short of a good length but the batsman is taking no chances early and comes down to present a very straight bat
driven forward this time
up there on off, defended on the front foot
played forward again
dabbed down off the back foot, pushed forward on the off side and they shuffle through a single
outside off, a good length, and wisely left
a hint of swing in the air as the ball lands on a good length, the batsman coming out and defended stoutly on the front foot
pushed through on a good length again and left alone outside off
room outside off, stands tall, gets in the line and defends on the back foot to the covers
on off, skews an inside edge that cuts back past the leg stump and on the way
outside off, swing away from the left hander, who dinks the ball out to poingt, where Clarke tidies up and wings it back in to prevent any thoughts of a single
outside off, only just, good length from Johnson forcing the batsman to defend
veering down leg, turned round through fine for easy runs
width outside off, down on one knee and launches one without getting under it properly, through the covers
outside off, enough width to be driven out to the covers
outside off again, a patient shot, the batsman waiting and deliberately opening the face to run the ball down to third man
comes forward and defends on the front foot
right up there and they ease out a single
a huge shout for one that was likely to have gone down although the batsman shuffled across, the benefit of the doubt was given
short, on leg, and defended back down
another muscular delivery, Johnson launching across the right ahnder who leaves it
makes him play this time with one which pitches on a good length on off, forcing the defensive
on leg, pushed to midwicket, and a loud call of "No!" comes in
right up there and defended on the back foot
wide across him, reaches out on a crouch to look to steer that to point, lets it go through in the end
right across him on off, defended off the back foot to the gully region
stays over the wicket to the left hander, Sangakkara pushing hard to third man off one which just moved across him
starts on off, nips back on to middle, and turned off the legs in front of square
on off, dabs one down into the covers and they run through, the pressure causing Symonds to fumble
nipping back in from outside off to on off, the ball driven back out to the covers
good length on off, defended into the covers on the front foot
nipped back in from outside off, kept low and Silva did well to stab down on it
a quick single brings Silva on strike
great ball across the right hander, slower ball pitching outside off and moving away, the batsman's forward defensive press in vain
outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
angled right in at the right hander, landing it on a perfectly tight length and forcing the forward defensive
width outside off, cut hard to backward point and picked up immediately
pushed to the covers for a single to end the over
right up there on off, defended on the front foot
walks across his stumps and yet there was no appeal for one which hit him on the pads
cut hard to point off the back foot
right up there and defended on the front foot
outside off, played on the back foot to point
right up there on off, pushed to the covers
up there and defended on the front foot
on leg, turned round the theoretical corner for two
no arguments about that one, a great delivery from Bracken that traps Sangakkara plumb in front of middle, the ball pitching back in and the batsman going to defend on the back foot
goes down on the front foot outside off and the ball pings off a sweep high and straight over the keeper, not where he was aiming it
wide down off
right up there, that one left alone through
slower ball dying on off, played back down
drags it down so it's a half tracker, gets away with it, the ball pulled round through square without much power
turned back in from outside off, defended down on the back foot
on leg, down on one knee and paddle-sweeps to fine
on leg again, looks to play it fine
on off, waits to make room to cut through the covers off the back foot
Hogg strikes in his first over, the ball grips on off, straightens and takes the feather as Silva tries to defend on the back foot, Gilchrist pouching the sliver
pushed across the right hander who drives straight through mid-off
pushed across him, left alone through
Hayden at first slip makes no mistake as the batsman goes for the booming drive away from the body as Bracken fires in another wicket-taking cutter
greets him with a slower ball outside off, left alone
wide outside off, driven back to the bowler who picks it up easily
nipped back in from outside off, and tucked neatly off the hips to fine leg
on off, played back down and out towards mid-on
outside off, driven out to mid-off
on middle and off, played back out to gully
quicker one, turns back in sharply to the batsman who just about gets some bat on it
fizzed past the left hander, turned a long way and got some good bounce through to Gilchrist
turned back in this time, played back down
awesome shot! Completely against the run of play Dilshan comes down the track and strikes a lofted drive straight, high and true over long-off and back into the crowd
tries to repeat the shot but nearly holes out, the ball stopping just short of long-off
pushed into the covers
played forward this time
yet another cutter pays dividends, as Dilshan sends a leading edge out to long off where Lee sets himself and has a firm base for taking the catch
short ball, outside off, fended to point
right up ethere and defended on the back foot
on the front foot now
pushed past the outside edge
worked out to mid-on
pushed very wide down leg
outside off, pushed to point, "Aw yes, Georgie," says Gilchrist
outside off, turns back in, swept out to deep square leg
on leg, looked to turn it to square
slower ball on off, the batsman comes forward and defends on the front foot
outside off and pulled hard in front of midwicket to bring up the 100
nipped back in from outside off, pushed into short midwicket
short outside off, played softly off the back foot to point
slower ball lifted right over mid-off and plugged just inside the rope, Johnson makes a vain dive and looks a bit silly, but has the decency to laugh about it afterwards
pitches outside off and turns right back in to the batsman who lets it hit him on the hip
looped up on off, defended on the front foot
pushed on to the back foot in front of off, defended
pitches just outside off and turns away from the left hander who's not deceived
defended forward
lets that one rap him on the pad as he tried to defend on the front foot and Gilchrist reckons that's "Nice, Hogga!"
nipped back in from just outside off to middle, defended on the back foot
pushed down the line, shortish, Malinga lets it slide through

on off, driven off the inside edge out to mid-on and there's a call for a run-out at the non-striker's end. Malinga loses his bat as the ball comes in from Symonds, but has he made his ground? Tricky one, although he's in the air as the ball hits the stumps. And he's out.
short, on middle and leg, and turned round through midwicket
right up there on off, defended on the back foot into the covers
defended this time
on middle, turned back out to leg, and played off the pads to fine leg
turned away from the left hander who shoulders arms
hit high in the air over to deep midwicket but short of the man there
on off, turned round in front of square, Murali collides with Hogg and the two have a good smile
rightu p there, defended on the front foot
outside off, pulled round through deep midwicket
Lee sees that he's backing away and follows him outside leg, the ball dug out to the legs. A mix-up results as Ponting slides in at mid-on and crashes down the stumps with the ball still in his hand
an overstep here
backed away from it but could not connect with an upper cut off the back foot
outside off and driven straight this time
full toss, stands on the back foot and drives to mid-on
right up there on off, driven out square to point
defended on the front foot in line with off
outside off, tries to pull it to midwicket
nipped back in from outside off, defended on the back foot
worked into the leg-side this time
outside off, turned back in
down the track, drives outside off to the covers
big air on that one, pushed to midwicket
too good, on off, moved away and was just too high for the off bail, Murali was nowhere near it
slower ball again, Murali gets right under the ball and drives it straight and over long-on
but he gets him this time, his best ODI figures and there's a five-for as the batsman goes to pull again over midwicket, but picks out the fielder instead
